segments.advisor_message: So, let’s think about risk like surfing, right? When you go out into the ocean, you have to be aware of the waves. If you’re not careful, you could wipe out. But if you pick the right waves, you can really ride them well and have a great time. It’s all about choosing the right wave to catch.
segments.client_message: I kinda get that, but like, what if I choose the wrong wave? Does that mean I’ll just lose all my money or something?

segments.advisor_message: Exactly! It’s about balancing the small waves with the bigger, riskier ones. Some waves are more predictable, which is like investing in safer stocks. Others are big and thrilling, but there's a chance of falling off, much like high-risk investments. You want to manage your choices carefully.
segments.client_message: Oh, okay, but it still feels a bit overwhelming, like, are there really safe waves out there? Do all waves have risks?

segments.advisor_message: Great question! Think of it like this: even calm waves can surprise you. But yes, some waves—like blue-chip stocks—have a history of being more stable. It's about finding your comfort level and which risks you’re okay with taking.
segments.client_message: That makes sense, I guess... so, like I don’t wanna get completely wiped out, but I do want to catch some good rides too. So maybe a mix would help?
